![](res.jpg)
# Question 1


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(skimr)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
restaurant <- read.csv('https://bcdanl.github.io/data/DOHMH_NYC_Restaurant_Inspection.csv')
```
:::



The following list is the 10 most common cuisines that have the highest proportion of Grade A.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
q2e <- restaurant %>% 
  group_by(CUISINE.DESCRIPTION) %>% 
  mutate(n = n()) %>% 
  ungroup() %>% 
  filter(dense_rank(-n) <= 10) %>% 
  group_by(CUISINE.DESCRIPTION, GRADE) %>% 
  count() %>% 
  group_by(CUISINE.DESCRIPTION) %>% 
  mutate(prop_A = n / sum(n)) %>% 
  filter(GRADE == 'A') %>% 
  arrange(-prop_A)

q2e
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

   CUISINE.DESCRIPTION      GRADE     n prop_A
   <chr>                    <chr> <int>  <dbl>
 1 Donuts                   A       499  0.988
 2 Coffee/Tea               A      1356  0.959
 3 American                 A      3505  0.953
 4 Italian                  A       653  0.948
 5 Pizza                    A       961  0.915
 6 Bakery Products/Desserts A       560  0.911
 7 Japanese                 A       529  0.906
 8 Mexican                  A       515  0.885
 9 Chinese                  A      1205  0.878
10 Latin American           A       464  0.853
```
